definitions.definition: write or create (a work of art, especially music or poetry).
examples: he composed the First Violin Sonata four years earlier

definitions.definition: write or phrase (a letter or piece of writing) with care and thought.
examples: the first sentence is so hard to compose

definitions.definition: form (a whole) by ordering or arranging the parts, especially in an artistic way.
examples: compose and draw a still life

definitions.definition: order or arrange (parts) to form a whole, especially in an artistic way.
examples: make an attempt to compose your images

definitions.definition: (of elements) constitute or make up (a whole).
examples: the system is composed of a group of machines
synonyms: form "the subcommittee is composed of ten senators"

definitions.definition: be (a specified number or amount) of a whole.
examples: women compose 49 percent of that group

definitions.definition: calm or settle (oneself or one's features or thoughts).
synonyms: decompress "you have to compose yourself before you take the stand"

examples: the king, with some difficulty, composed this difference

definitions.definition: prepare (a text) for printing by manually, mechanically, or electronically setting up the letters and other characters in the order to be printed.
set up (letters and characters) of a text in preparation for printing.
